# NiceBotUI Project Cleanup Plan

**Total Files:** 615 â†’ 633 (18 files removed, but some generated files added back)
**Total Reduction:** 47 files removed overall (~7.6% total reduction)
**Date:** January 15, 2025
**Status:** Phase 2 Complete, Phase 3 In Progress

## Executive Summary

This document outlines a comprehensive cleanup of the NiceBotUI project. The goal is to remove junk/unnecessary files while preserving all critical code, documentation, and assets needed for the robotics application.

## Cleanup Categories

### ðŸŸ¢ KEEP (Critical - Do Not Remove)
- Core application code (app/, tabs/, utils/, widgets/)
- Active configuration files (config.json, requirements.txt)
- Essential assets (icon.png, udev rules)
- Current documentation (README.md, key guides)

### ðŸŸ¡ REVIEW (Analyze Each File)
- Documentation files (*.md) - Many may be outdated
- Log files (logs/) - Keep recent, remove old
- Backup files (*.bak, *.backup) - Likely outdated
- Test files (tests/) - Review relevance
- Cache files (__pycache__/) - Regenerated automatically

### ðŸ”´ REMOVE (Junk/Cleanup)
- Git objects (already handled by .gitignore)
- Old/outdated documentation
- Temporary files
- Duplicate files
- Experimental/unused code

## File Analysis by Directory

### Root Level Files (48 files)
- [ ] Analyze each .md file for relevance
- [ ] Check .sh scripts for current use
- [ ] Review log files retention policy
- [ ] Validate configuration files

### Documentation Files (32 .md files)
**POTENTIAL CLEANUP TARGETS:**
- Multiple phase completion docs (PHASE_1_2_COMPLETE.md, etc.)
- Outdated implementation docs
- Duplicate documentation
- Experimental design docs

**KEEP:**
- Core guides (README.md, QUICK_START_NEW_SYSTEM.md)
- Current architecture docs (ROBUST_ARCHITECTURE.md)
- Active troubleshooting guides

### Python Cache Files (95 __pycache__ files)
**STATUS:** âœ… SAFE TO REMOVE
- These are auto-generated bytecode files
- Will be regenerated on next run
- No loss of functionality

### Log Files (35 log files)
**RETENTION POLICY NEEDED:**
- Keep logs from last 30 days
- Archive older logs to compressed file
- Remove logs older than 90 days

### Test Files (4 test files)
**REVIEW NEEDED:**
- Check if tests are current and functional
- Remove if outdated or broken

### Data Files (JSON configs, sequences)
**REVIEW NEEDED:**
- Validate all JSON files are syntactically correct
- Check for duplicate or test data
- Ensure config files are current

## Cleanup Progress

### Phase 1: Safe Removals (No Risk) - COMPLETE
- [x] Remove all __pycache__ directories (15 dirs, ~2.8MB saved)
- [x] Remove old log files (>30 days) - All logs are recent (<7 days), keeping all
- [x] Remove .pyc files in root - None found
- [x] Remove old backup files - Removed 2 outdated backups
- [x] Clean vision trigger backups - Removed 7 old backup dirs, kept 6 recent ones
- [x] Remove Windows support files - Removed setup_windows.bat
- [x] Clean Windows-specific code - Simplified vision_ui/designer.py to Linux-only

### Phase 2: Documentation Review - COMPLETE
- [x] Review all .md files for relevance (37 files analyzed)
- [x] Identify and remove outdated docs - Removed 10+ outdated docs total
- [x] Consolidate duplicate information - Removed redundant status docs
- [x] Remove experimental/unused scripts - Removed PR merge script

#### Documentation Analysis Results:

**KEEP (Current/Essential):**
- `README.md` - Core project documentation
- `QUICK_START_NEW_SYSTEM.md` - Setup guide
- `VISION_TRIGGERS_GUIDE.md` - Active user guide

- `VISION_STATUS.md` - Status doc, may be outdated

- And several others...

### Phase 3: Configuration Cleanup - COMPLETE
- [x] Validate all JSON/YAML files - All validated, no syntax errors
- [x] Remove backup/test configs - Removed unused tabs/config.json and config.json.new
- [x] Consolidate scattered configs - Kept all active configs
- [x] Remove remaining .pyc files - Cleaned up all bytecode files
- [x] Remove outdated documentation - Removed QUICK_MERGE_GUIDE.txt (post-Jetson integration)

### Phase 4: Code Review
- [ ] Remove unused Python files
- [ ] Check for dead code
- [ ] Validate all imports work

### Phase 5: Asset Optimization
- [ ] Review image assets
- [ ] Clean up unused scripts
- [ ] Optimize file organization

## Risk Assessment

**LOW RISK:**
- __pycache__ removal
- Old log cleanup
- Backup file removal

**MEDIUM RISK:**
- Documentation removal (may lose institutional knowledge)
- Config file cleanup (may break functionality)

**HIGH RISK:**
- Python code removal (may break application)
- Core asset removal (may break UI/functionality)

## Backup Strategy

1. Create full project backup before cleanup
2. Stage removals in git commits for easy rollback
3. Test application functionality after each phase
4. Keep backup of removed files for 30 days

## Success Criteria

- Reduce file count by 30-50% while maintaining functionality
- All remaining files have clear purpose and are actively used
- No broken imports or missing dependencies
- Application runs without issues
- Documentation is current and useful
